summary: This document is a series of emails from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio to various judges and SEC officials, appealing the SEC's preliminary denial of his whistleblower award claim related to the Oppenheimer AML action (2015-016). Dilorio alleges massive, ongoing securities fraud involving abusive naked short selling, money laundering through OTC market shells, and criminal obstruction by the SEC and DOJ to protect entities like Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu (NITE) and Jefferies. He claims his information was used by regulators to bring complaints while simultaneously being suppressed to protect powerful financial figures and institutions.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: The author of the emails, a former institutional sales trader who filed extensive TCRs (Tips, Complaints, and Referrals) with the SEC alleging massive fraud involving Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu, UBS, and others. He is appealing the denial of his whistleblower award.

persons.name: Judge Cave
persons.context: Recipient of Dilorio's email, asked to review attachments as 'irrefutable proof' of criminal activity by Handler/Jefferies and the SEC's bailout of Knight Capital.

persons.context: Recipient of Dilorio's email, asked to review attachments as 'irrefutable proof' of criminal activity by Handler/Jefferies and the SEC's bailout of Knight Capital.

persons.name: Handler

persons.name: Cifu
persons.context: Alleged to have written down 'BILLIONS in fraud assets' on KCG's balance sheet just before the Virtu acquisition closed in July 2017, grossly inflating the tangible book value from which Handler/Jefferies benefited.

connections.description: Dilorio is a whistleblower accusing Handler (CEO of Jefferies) of being at the center of a corrupt relationship with the SEC to bail out and facilitate fraud at Knight Capital/KCG.
Handler is described as a Milken/Drexel protégé, part of a network allegedly involved in repeated bailouts of NITE (Knight Capital).
Dilorio alleges a 'corrupt/criminal relationship' where the SEC and DOJ obstruct investigations and facilitate bailouts to protect Jefferies and its leadership.
Coleman ran Equities at UBS during its period of Reg SHO violations and cross-border AML issues before becoming CEO of KCG.
Alleged to have traded billions of shares in the same OTC market shells (like CGFIA, APCX) to facilitate abusive naked short selling and money laundering, with the SEC protecting both.
Sason's entities are alleged customers/beneficiaries of the money laundering schemes, with NITE as the primary executing broker/dealer converting worthless certificates into real money.
Both previously at Sullivan Cromwell; Fishman advised Knight/KCG/Virtu on transactions alleged to facilitate fraud, creating a conflict Clayton did not disclose.
Dilorio filed multiple complaints with IG Hoecker, accusing him of obstruction for never interviewing him and not informing Congress, violating IG mandates.
Linked through Gruntal; Feinberg's Cerberus bid on NITE post-'glitch' as part of the alleged Milken network.

events.title: Knight Capital 'Trading Glitch'
events.description: A massive trading loss event at Knight Capital Group. Dilorio alleges it was not a glitch but proof of Knight's insolvency and massive accounting fraud from naked short fails, leading to an SEC-orchestrated bailout.

events.title: Dilorio/Berger TCR Submission
events.description: Christopher Dilorio, with attorney Marc Berger, submitted a detailed TCR to the SEC alleging massive fraud at Knight Capital, UBS, and related entities involving naked short selling and money laundering.

events.title: SEC Oppenheimer AML Action (2015-016)
events.description: The SEC brought an administrative proceeding against Oppenheimer & Co. for anti-money laundering failures. Dilorio claims this action was based on his information but was crafted to protect larger entities like NITE and UBS.

events.title: Virtu Acquisition of KCG Closes
events.description: Virtu Financial acquired KCG Holdings. Dilorio alleges that just prior to closing, CEO Cifu wrote down billions in fraudulent 'assets' (naked short fails) from KCG's balance sheet, inflating the tangible book value and benefiting Handler/Jefferies.

events.title: SEC Charges Against Joshua Sason et al.
events.description: The SEC charged Joshua Sason and others for microcap frauds. Dilorio claims this was his information, filed years earlier in separate TCRs, and questions why executing brokers like NITE were not implicated.

events.title: SEC Preliminary Denial of Dilorio's Award
events.description: The SEC Office of the Whistleblower issued a preliminary denial of Dilorio's award claim for the Oppenheimer covered action (2015-016), claiming investigators never saw his information. Dilorio appeals, calling this fabricated and part of the obstruction.

keyFacts: The whistleblower, Christopher Dilorio, alleges the SEC and DOJ have engaged in a multi-year criminal obstruction to protect Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu (NITE) and Jefferies from investigation for massive naked short selling and money laundering via OTC market shells.

Dilorio claims his TCRs, submitted as early as 2011 and formally in 2013, provided irrefutable proof of this fraud but were used by the SEC selectively to bring smaller actions (like against Oppenheimer) while shielding the primary perpetrators.

A central allegation is that the August 2012 Knight Capital 'glitch' was proof of insolvency and accounting fraud, leading to an SEC-facilitated bailout that transferred control to a consortium including Jefferies, JPMorgan, and Goldman Sachs.

Dilorio asserts the SEC, through the DTCC, maintains an illegal 'Obligation Warehouse' that allows firms like NITE to circumvent Rule 204 close-out requirements for failed trades, perpetuating the naked short selling scheme.

The document connects the alleged financial fraud to powerful political figures, suggesting links to Trump, Kushner, and Milken networks, and claims the SEC's corruption extends to its Inspector General and Chair.
